title: Circular Design Helps Homeowners Waste Less, Preserve More - National Association of REALTORS®
summary: Circular design is a philosophy that focuses on creating décor, fixtures and spaces with extended life cycles to reduce waste. Circular design is a type of sustainable design. Homeowners can incorporate circular design into their homes by going vintage, prioritizing recycled and recyclable products, getting pickier about building materials, sourcing "forever" pieces, and reimagining the home structure itself.
green_innovation: TRUE. Circular design is a green innovation because it contributes to environmental sustainability goals by reducing waste.
business_innovation: TRUE. Circular design is a business innovation because it is a new or improved product or business process that differs significantly from the firm's previous products or business processes.
green_product: TRUE. Products designed to be recycled and reused, such as bathroom tiles made from recycled materials, which are designed to be recycled again, are green products.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe a green process.

greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not provide any evidence that circular design is an example of greenwashing.

title: Back to the future - accelerating the adoption of circularity - Philips
summary: The article discusses the importance of circularity in addressing environmental challenges, particularly in the healthcare industry. It emphasizes that the current linear economic model is unsustainable and that we need to transition to a circular economy where resources are reused, repaired, and recycled. The article also highlights the need for rapid acceleration in the adoption of circularity, especially in healthcare.
green_innovation: TRUE, the article discusses the importance of circularity in addressing environmental challenges, which is a key aspect of green innovation.
business_innovation: TRUE, the article discusses the need for healthcare to move beyond the design and production of hardware and take an integrated view of equipment, services, and digital solutions. This suggests that the article is describing a business innovation.
green_product: TRUE, the article discusses the need for healthcare to adopt circularity, which involves using products that are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, the article discusses the need for healthcare to adopt circularity, which involves implementing processes that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.

title: Introducing Coachtopia: A new world of circular craft from Coach. Powered by community, building towards a better ... - PR Newswire
summary: Coach, a global fashion house, has launched Coachtopia, a new brand and collaborative platform for change that aims to reimagine the end-to-end system of fashion. Coachtopia is designed for and with a new generation of consumers who are increasingly passionate about circularity and determined to drive change. Coachtopia is taking a circular approach to fashion, designing products to be more easily disassembled, repaired and reimagined for second and even third lives and committing to take back all Coachtopia products, regardless of age or condition, and finding ways to reuse them.
likely_naics_codes: ['316999 - Other Leather and Allied Product Manufacturing', '448150 - Clothing Accessories Stores', '315991 - Footwear Manufacturing', '448190 - Other Clothing Stores']

title: Taking used electronics out of the landfills and back into business - Cisco Newsroom
summary: Cisco has had programs in place to facilitate product returns for reuse and recycling for over two decades. The company's circular design focus areas include design for disassembly, repair, and reuse, and they have pledged to support 100% of product returns globally upon request at no cost to their customers. Cisco also offers programs like Refresh, Green Pay, Takeback and Reuse that can help reduce environmental impacts from technology installation to end of life.
green_innovation: TRUE, Cisco's circular design focus areas and commitment to product takeback and recycling contribute to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE, Cisco's Refresh program offers certified Cisco remanufactured equipment with the same warranty and support options as new Cisco products, but at discounted prices.
green_product: TRUE, Cisco's Refresh program offers remanufactured equipment that uses less energy than manufacturing a new product.
green_process: FALSE, the article discusses programs and initiatives but does not describe a specific green process.
likely_naics_codes: ['334290 - Other Computer and Electronic Product Manufacturing', '334419 - Other Electronic Computer Manufacturing', '423430 - Computer and Computer Peripheral Equipment and Software Merchant Wholesalers', '561920 - IT Consulting Services']
greenwashing: FALSE, the described product or process innovation is not an example of greenwashing.

title: Starting with the end in mind: Primark launches its first circular product collection - Primark
summary: Primark is launching its first product range designed and made to be reloved or recycled. The collection is made up of universally loved shapes, designs and colours that can be mixed and matched with your wardrobe staples. Every piece in the collection has been carefully designed to support Primark’s ambition to move towards a more circular future.
green_innovation: TRUE - The collection is designed to be more sustainable, durable, and recyclable, which contributes to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE - The collection is a new product range that differs significantly from Primark's previous products and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE - The collection is made from more sustainably sourced materials and is designed to be more durable and recyclable.
green_process: FALSE - The article does not describe a specific green process.

title: Primark launches its first circular clothing range - News - The Chemical Engineer
summary: Primark has launched its first product range designed to be reused or recycled, as the company moves towards a more circular future. The newly launched clothing collection comprises 35 pieces across kids wear, menswear, and womenswear. Clothes in the collection are made from at least 95% cotton from Primark’s sustainable cotton programme, which trains farmers to use sustainable practices.
green_innovation: TRUE, Primark's new circular product standard and clothing collection are designed to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability throughout the product lifecycle.
business_innovation: TRUE, Primark's new circular product standard and clothing collection represent a new or improved product and business process that differs significantly from the firm's previous products or business processes.
green_product: TRUE, Primark's new clothing collection is made from at least 95% cotton from Primark’s sustainable cotton programme, and is designed for enhanced durability.
green_process: TRUE, Primark's new circular product standard outlines what constitutes a circular fashion product and will be updated annually to reflect Primark’s progress in this area.
product_or_process: Primark's new circular product standard and clothing collection

title: Coach embraces Gen Z and circularity with Coachtopia launch - Fashion Network
summary: Coach has developed Coachtopia, a sustainable line for Gen Z made from waste materials. The initiative prioritizes redesigning the production process and is part of a larger movement towards circularity in fashion.
green_innovation: TRUE; Coachtopia reduces the creation of new materials by crafting with waste and designing products that can be reimagined, remade and recycled to live multiple lives.
business_innovation: TRUE; Coachtopia is a new product line that differs significantly from the firm’s previous products and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE; Coachtopia bags are made from leftover materials that usually go straight to landfill, such as the offcuts, zipper ends and the like that were previously seen as unusable.
green_process: TRUE; Coachtopia products are designed for multiple lives, with easily disassembled construction and exposed hardware for easier repair and remaking.

greenwashing: FALSE; Coachtopia is not an example of greenwashing because it genuinely reduces the creation of new materials and designs products for multiple lives.

title: Solgaard Launches Mono-Material, Fully Circular Backpack; A Red Dot 2023 Product Design Award Winner - PR Newswire
summary: Solgaard, a sustainable travel and lifestyle brand, has launched its first mono-material, fully circular backpack. The Solgaard Circular Backpack is made from recycled and recyclable materials, exemplifying innovative and achievable circularity in product design. Solgaard's backpack was named a 2023 Red Dot: Product Design Award Winner for its exceptional sustainable design.
